title: Stocks fall and Dow swings 260 points after a dour report on American factories
text:
New York (CNN Business) The US stock market turned negative, and the Dow swung 260 points, on Monday after a key economic report showed that American factory activity fell to its lowest level in more than 10 years.

The ISM manufacturing index dropped to 47.8 in September, compared with the Refinitiv consensus forecast of 50.1. A level above 50 marks growth. It was the lowest reading since June 2009, which was the last month of the recession, according to the Institute of Supply Management.

The manufacturing sector shrank for the first time in three years in August, as it feels the pain of the trade war and slowing global demand.

Stocks didn't like the data one bit and pared earlier gains.

Dow INDU S&P 500 SPX Nasdaq Composite COMP Thefell more than 111 points, or 0.4%, while thefell 0.3%. Thewas slightly lower.

description: The US stock market turned negative, and the Dow swung 260 points, on Monday after a key economic report showed that American factory activity fell to its lowest level in more than 10 years.
